posts.post_content:
Solid 3-Color commander  
  
Combos with:  
M13 rings specifically, [Ring of Xathrid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ring of Xathrid), [Ring of Kalonia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ring of Kalonia), and [Ring of Thune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ring of Thune).  
[Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season)  
and cards with Proliferate like [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine), [Contagion Clasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Clasp)  
or maybe even [Plaguemaw Beast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plaguemaw Beast) or [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth).  
  
I like it.
posts.html:
Solid 3-Color commander

Combos with:
M13 rings specifically, Ring of Xathrid, Ring of Kalonia, and Ring of Thune.
Doubling Season
and cards with Proliferate like Contagion Engine, Contagion Clasp
or maybe even Plaguemaw Beast or Throne of Geth.

I like it.

posts.post_content: It's not the most creative, but he can be a lot of fun in a typical fungus deck. Plus if you get him out with a [Sporesower Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sporesower Thallid) and a [Sporoloth Ancient](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sporoloth Ancient), you can get him pregnant!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Absolutely insanity with this guy on the field. Just built an EDH around this kid with a [Trostani, Selesnya's Voice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani, Selesnya's Voice) in the deck. The lolz to be had are many.  
But, seriously- this guy with populate is DISGUSTINGLY GOOD. Whether you populate a 1/1 for efficient creature buffing or generate a vigilance/flying token and make it a noncard fatty doesn't matter- cuz this guy can do either single-handed. 5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content: So I'm not sure if this has been stated yet... but [Cathar's Crusade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathar's Crusade) + [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) + either [Life and Limb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life and Limb) or[Utopia Mycon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Utopia Mycon) = infinite saprolings and infinite +1/+1 counters on all creatures you control.
posts.html:
So I'm not sure if this has been stated yet... but Cathar's Crusade + Doubling Season + either Life and Limb orUtopia Mycon = infinite saprolings and infinite +1/+1 counters on all creatures you control.

posts.post_content:
"Hi there, Ghave. This is my friend, [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace). I thought you guys might get along."  
  
Five minutes later...  
  
"Ghave, do you take this... horrid... abomination to be your wife? You do? Well then... I'd say kiss the bride, but I don't know how exactly you would go about doing that..."

posts.post_content: He's fast becoming my favorite card to come out of the first Commander product. His colors, White, Black, and Green, have a huge number of cards that interact with and benefit from +1/+1 counters and creature tokens.
posts.html:

Posted By: Nagoragama (3/27/2013 5:09:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. [Ivy Lane Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Lane Denizen) means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with [Vhati il-Dal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vhati il-Dal) - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and [Deathspore Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathspore Thallid). The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.
posts.html:
Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. Ivy Lane Denizen means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with Vhati il-Dal - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and Deathspore Thallid. The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.

Posted By: StyrofoamKing (6/1/2013 10:52:11 AM)

posts.post_content: How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.
posts.html:
How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. Contagion Engine becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.
